verbose_text: The placenta has lipase activity, and the tireless efforts of another postdoctoral fellow demonstrated that the activity of placental lipoprotein lipase, important in hydrolyzing maternal TGs to FFAs that can be transported across the placenta, is highly correlated with NB% fat by skinfolds at birth (r = 0.59; P = 0.006) and even more so when corrected for gestational age at delivery (r = 0.75; P = 0.0001).
